articles.title: Tim Cook says Apple ‘must’ figure out AI and ‘will make the investment to do it’
articles.description: Apple CEO Tim Cook boasted about the potential of AI and the company’s approach to developing it in a rare all-hands today that was reported on by Bloomberg. Apple has been slow to roll out some of its AI features and has stumbled with a planned AI-powered upgrade to Siri, which it delayed earlier this […]

articles.title: Google's deepfake hunter sees what you can’t—even in videos without faces
articles.description: AI-generated videos are becoming dangerously convincing and UC Riverside researchers have teamed up with Google to fight back. Their new system, UNITE, can detect deepfakes even when faces aren't visible, going beyond traditional methods by scanning backgrounds, motion, and subtle cues. As fake content becomes easier to generate and harder to detect, this universal tool might become essential for newsrooms and social media platforms trying to safeguard the truth.
articles.content: AI-generated videos are becoming dangerously convincing and UC Riverside researchers have teamed up with Google to fight back. Their new system, UNITE, can detect deepfakes even when faces aren't visible, going beyond traditional methods by scanning backgrounds, motion, and subtle cues. As fake content becomes easier to generate and harder to detect, this universal tool might become essential for newsrooms and social media platforms trying to safeguard the truth.

articles.title: AI is contributing to Meta’s growth – just not the kind anyone cares about
articles.description: Good old machine learning, not LLMs, are what’s really paying for Zuck’s genAI splurge Believe it or not, Meta's AI investments made a meaningful difference to its advertising business in Q2 — it's just that those models aren't the kind that's got everyone, including the Social Network, plowing tens of billions of dollars a year into datacenters.…

articles.title: Python 3.14 release candidate 1 is go!
articles.description: It’s the first 3.14 release candidate! https://www.python.org/downloads/release/python-3140rc1/ This is the first release candidate of Python 3.14 This release, 3.14.0rc1, is the penultimate release preview. Entering the release candidate phase, only reviewed code changes which are clear bug fixes are allowed between this release candidate and the final release. The second candidate (and the last planned release preview) is scheduled for Tuesday, 2025-08-26, while the official release of 3.14.0...
articles.author: Hugo (noreply@blogger.com)
articles.content: It’s the first 3.14 release candidate! https://www.python.org/downloads/release/python-3140rc1/ This is the first release candidate of Python 3.14 This release, 3.14.0rc1, is the penultimate release preview. Entering the release candidate phase, only reviewed code changes which are clear bug fixes are allowed between this release candidate and the final release. The second candidate (and the last planned release preview) is scheduled for Tuesday, 2025-08-26, while the official release of 3.14.0...

articles.title: Azure native integration elevates Elastic Cloud Serverless experience
articles.description: We're thrilled to announce a significant leap forward in making Elastic Cloud Serverless even more accessible and powerful for Azure users. With the general availability (GA) of Elastic Cloud Serverless on Azure, we've just released the Azure native integration for Elastic Cloud Serverless. This builds upon our existing Azure native integration for Elastic Cloud Hosted, allowing users to seamlessly discover and manage Elastic Cloud in a way that feels inherently part of the Azure...
articles.author: Piyush Dash,Eric Demers,Greg Crist
articles.content: We're thrilled to announce a significant leap forward in making Elastic Cloud Serverless even more accessible and powerful for Azure users. With the general availability (GA) of Elastic Cloud Serverless on Azure, we've just released the Azure native integration for Elastic Cloud Serverless. This builds upon our existing Azure native integration for Elastic Cloud Hosted, allowing users to seamlessly discover and manage Elastic Cloud in a way that feels inherently part of the Azure...

articles.title: Harvard’s ultra-thin chip could revolutionize quantum computing
articles.description: Researchers at Harvard have created a groundbreaking metasurface that can replace bulky and complex optical components used in quantum computing with a single, ultra-thin, nanostructured layer. This innovation could make quantum networks far more scalable, stable, and compact. By harnessing the power of graph theory, the team simplified the design of these quantum metasurfaces, enabling them to generate entangled photons and perform sophisticated quantum operations — all on a chip thinner than...
articles.content: Researchers at Harvard have created a groundbreaking metasurface that can replace bulky and complex optical components used in quantum computing with a single, ultra-thin, nanostructured layer.
